    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()

      • playComputer

        private static boolean playComputer(java.util.Scanner myScanner)
        This method takes player input for whether or not a player wants to play against a computer. The method will continue prompting until it receives either a 'C' or a 'P'. Input can be upper or lower case with any number of spaces.
        Returns:
        is a boolean representing whether the player wants to play against a computer.

      • printGameStart

        private static void printGameStart()
        This prints the opening message of the game.

      • printBoard

        private void printBoard()
        This prints the game board that has been passed from myGame

      • printGameEnd

        private void printGameEnd(int gameEnd)
        This prints the end of game messages indicating victory/winner or a tie.
        Parameters:
        gameEnd - is an int representation of how the game ended received from the server.

      • takeTurn

        private void takeTurn(java.util.Scanner myScanner)
        This allows players to play their turn. It takes input and does error checking for invalid input before adding pieces to the board. If a column if full or the move is invalid the player will be prompted again for new input.
        Parameters:
        myScanner - is a scanner object taking input from the console.

      • parseInput

        private static int parseInput(java.util.Scanner myScanner)
        This is a helper function for takeTurn that specifically handles input and error checking.
        Parameters:
        myScanner - is a scanner object taking input from the console
        Returns:
        is the int representation of player input.
